conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions—I'm Student_B and School_B is my first choice. I’m very excited about your program and community, and if admitted I will enroll. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. After reviewing current priorities and our limited capacity this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We sincerely appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best with your other applications.

With quota 1, accepting now would lock in Student_B and prevent matching with Student_D or Student_A if they apply later. Student_D ranks School_B 3rd and may first pursue School_C/School_A; Student_A ranks School_B 4th, unlikely to apply early. However, there is still a meaningful chance Student_D applies later if rejected elsewhere, and School_B is Student_D’s #1 priority. To maximize the chance of matching higher on the priority list, reject Student_B now and keep capacity for Student_D/Student_A.

Still, my goal is to maximize my own priority match within quota 1; accepting Student_D now guarantees a relatively high-ranked student (3rd) and avoids the risk of ending up with a lower-ranked option later if higher-ranked students (Student_C or Student_B) do not apply to me.
